abstract: Aides who were captured with Libya's Col Muammar el-Qaddafi say that after 42 years of absolute power, he spent his last days hovering between defiance, anger and delusion; describe squalid conditions of his last days, saying that he was repeatedly counseled to leave power or the country, but that he would not even consider the option.
snippet: After 42 years of absolute power in Libya, Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi spent his last days hovering between defiance, anger and delusion, surviving on rice and pasta, according to an aide captured with him.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: After 42 years of absolute power in Libya, Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi spent his last days hovering between defiance, anger and delusion, surviving on rice and pasta, according to an aide captured with him.

headline.main: In His Last Days, Qaddafi Wearied of Fugitive’s Life
headline.print_headline: In His Last Days, Qaddafi Wearied of Fugitive's Life
